results.title: Understanding aggression
results.creator_credit: Ronald H. Riley, R.H.R. Productions and Margaret Thomson
results.brief_description: Intended for teaching psychiatric nursing, this is a study of aggression, a normal reaction which the well-balanced person learns to control but which presents a difficult problem in the psychiatric hospital.

results.title: Understanding A.D.D.: Attention Deficit Disorder
results.creator_credit: Australian Video Publishers and Bryan Lowe
results.brief_description: Dr. Christopher Green, author of the famous “Toddler taming” and “Babies”, is a leading authority on Attention Deficit Disorder. This program, designed for parents, teachers and healthcare professionals, investigates key issues about the disorder. It profiles the causes of ADD, behaviours associated with the condition, diagnosis, treatment, medication, adult manifestations of the condition and includes a segment with questions from the audience.

results.title: Underground water
results.creator_credit: Forum Australia, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Roland Beckett
results.brief_description: The importance of underground water in Australia. Indicates the extent to which the cattle country relies on bore water and the work being done by geologists and hydrographers in the field, and the scientists in laboratories, on the problem of desalination.

results.title: Underage
results.creator_credit: Lemon Film, Lizzie Lemon and Kim Longinotto
results.brief_description: A look at a group of eight teenagers - all in the 15/16 age group - who live in Coventry. The film traces the pressures of growing up without real prospects of employment and it examines the teenagers’ need to prove their identity. Subjects discussed include, racism, glue-sniffing, petty theft and promiscuity.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lemon Film, Lizzie Lemon and Kim Longinotto

results.title: Under western skies
results.brief_description: A survey of the dry farming and the irrigation farming practices carried out in the western states of USA furing the 1940’s. Criticism made towards farmers, ranchers and timber merchants for land abuse, soil degradation and water irrigation. Examples shown of conservation farming.

results.title: Under the skin (E)
results.creator_credit: Kate Ogburn, BFI, Channel 4 Films, Strange Dog Prod and Carine Adler
results.brief_description: Samantha Morton is Iris, a young woman who is increasingly estranged from her happily married older sister, Rose (Claire Rushbrook). When their mother is diagnosed with a terminal disease Iris is thrown into such a turmoil of grief, anger and despair that she leaves her home, her job and her boyfriend and attempts to dull her pain by immersing herself into a frenzied abuse of alcohol, drugs and sex. As if countering her jealousy of Rose by becoming her exact opposite, Iris involves herself in casual sado-masochistic encounters that leave her both exhilarated and disturbed. “Under the Skin” won the Jury Prize at the Toronto Film Festival and the Michael Powell Award at the Edinburgh Film Festival. Carine Adler’s debut feature film dares to tackle the ambiguities and contradictions of female sexuality and female competition in a contemporary world were many of the challenges of second-wave feminism have become accepted and institutionalised. In allowing Iris to be boldly naked - physically, metaphysically, and emotionally - Samantha Morton creates an unique and stunning central character. Cast also includes Rita Tushingham as the mother.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kate Ogburn, BFI, Channel 4 Films, Strange Dog Prod and Carine Adler
